bibl.title: Coptic or Greek? Bilingualism in the Papyri. Annotated and Edited for Publication by Arietta PAPACONSTANTINOU.
bibl.note: Introduction. - [Part I]: The origins of the Coptic language; - Greek-language influence in Egypt; - Old Coptic; - Greek loan-words in Coptic; - Outline of the Coptic language; - Copto-Greek; - Morphology of Copto-Greek; - Bilingual interference; - Education in Coptic and Greek. - Part II: The texts; - The earliest Coptic documents: Fourth-century bilingual archives; - Archives from Kellis; - The Archive of Apa John; - Sixth-century bilingual Coptic and Greek archives; - Dioskoros of Aphroditō: Poet, notary, teacher; - Pachom of This - Purple-dealer; - Patermouthis of Syene: Boatman-cum-soldier; - Coptic or Greek? Uncertainty as to which language is used for a document; - Coptic document with a Greek summary; - Late Coptic documents in Greek script only; - The eighth century and beyond. - Concluding remarks.
